name: Neo4j
description: Neo4j is the world's leading graph database. It is designed to store, manage, and query highly connected data.

name: ArangoDB
description: ArangoDB is a native multi-model database with flexible data models for documents, graphs, and key-values.

name: JanusGraph
description: JanusGraph is a scalable graph database optimized for storing and querying large graphs with billions of vertices and edges distributed across a multi-machine cluster.

name: OrientDB
description: OrientDB is a distributed graph database with the flexibility of document databases, providing a hybrid model with both document and graph concepts.

name: DataStax Enterprise Graph
description: DataStax Enterprise Graph is a distributed graph database built on top of Apache Cassandra, designed for managing large, complex graph datasets at scale.

name: GraphDB
description: GraphDB is a semantic graph database that supports RDF and SPARQL, allowing for the efficient management and querying of large and complex graph datasets.

name: AllegroGraph
description: AllegroGraph is a semantic graph database designed for managing large and complex datasets with high concurrency and availability requirements. It supports RDF, SPARQL, and Prolog.

name: Amazon Neptune
description: Amazon Neptune is a fully-managed graph database service that allows you to store and query highly connected data with ease.

name: Cayley
description: Cayley is an open source graph database inspired by Google's Knowledge Graph, providing a simple and easy-to-use interface for managing and querying graphs.

name: Dgraph
description: Dgraph is a native graph database that is designed for real-time queries and high availability. It supports GraphQL and provides a distributed, horizontally scalable architecture.

name: GraphBase
description: GraphBase is a graph database management system that provides efficient storage and querying of large and complex graph datasets. It supports a range of query languages, including Cypher and Gremlin.

name: Graph Story
description: Graph Story is a cloud-based graph database service that provides an easy-to-use interface for managing and querying large and complex graph datasets.

name: InfiniteGraph
description: InfiniteGraph is a distributed graph database that is designed for managing large and complex datasets with high performance and scalability. It supports Java and .NET APIs for easy integration.

name: MarkLogic
description: MarkLogic is a NoSQL database that provides advanced search and semantic capabilities for managing complex data. It supports RDF, SPARQL, and JavaScript for querying graph data.

name: Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB
description: Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB is a globally distributed, multi-model database service that provides support for graph, document, and key-value data models.

name: Oracle Spatial and Graph
description: Oracle Spatial and Graph is a spatial and graph database that provides advanced analytics and modeling capabilities for managing complex data. It supports RDF, SPARQL, and Java APIs for querying graph data.

name: Oracle NoSQL Database
description: Oracle NoSQL Database is a distributed, key-value store database that provides support for graph data models. It is designed for high performance and scalability, and provides easy integration with Java APIs.
